line-7: 🌟 Join Our Team at Network Rail! 🌟     Are you ready to make a difference in people's lives? At Network Rail, we connect passengers and freight customers, ensuring safe and efficient transportation across the country. We're an organisation where people truly matter, and when you join us, you matter to us and millions of others. Click here to watch our inspiring video to learn more about us!  We're dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive organisation that reflects the passengers we serve. To achieve this, we're committed to becoming an open, diverse, and inclusive workplace, leveraging the skills and expertise of our talented workforce. Together, we strive to create a safe and accessible railway for everyone. Discover more about the importance of Diversity and Inclusion at Network Rail by clicking here.  Investing in our people is key to enhancing the safety, reliability, and efficiency of our railway system. If you're passionate about making a meaningful impact, then this opportunity is for you!  About our people and the recruitment process - We're an inclusive employer of choice and we welcome applications from everyone! We encourage our colleagues to work flexibly, as we know traditional working patterns don't always fit. If you want to consider working flexibly, just let us know and we'll do our best to help and invest in your career with us, whilst you have a healthy work life balance.     We're also a Disability Confident Leader employer and we'll try our best to adapt the process and offer a reasonable alternative to help support people with disabilities access, apply and interview for roles.  About the function�  Our Communications function is responsible for ensuring that Network Rail presents a consistent narrative about the company and its strategy. The team integrates Network Rail�s long-term business strategy with its external stakeholder communications and internal employee engagement.
line-9: Who are we looking for?  We are looking for somebody with a can-do attitude who is passionate about putting our employees at the heart of all communications. They will like working with and through others and representing communications as a strategic, trusted advisor within our areas of the business: focusing particularly on Route Services � one of Network Rail�s largest functions which delivers more than 65 critical services, from IT to payroll; Supply Chain Operations to Commercial & Procurement and much more. They will have experience of pulling together and delivering communications plans and enjoy having lots of projects on the go. Their leadership style encourages those around them to look at things differently and they will be proactive and welcome trying new things.
line-11: What does the average day look like?   Every day will be different, but you leading and coaching people to achieve impactful communications outcomes will be a permanent feature. You�ll lead a team of communication managers, who will support delivery across our functions. You will be prepared to upskill and challenge areas to think differently about where communications can add value and achieve behavioural change. You will work with the head of communications to develop, drive and implement communications plans to deliver business objectives and drive performance. Establishing and maintaining strong and trusting relationships is key to success, as well as building your communication network internally and externally to make sure you learn and achieve best practice communications.       What essential skills and experiences are required?  We're looking for someone who brings a blend of skills and experiences to our team. Whether you hold a degree or professional communications qualification, or if you've gained your expertise through hands-on experience, excellent communication � both written and spoken � is at the core of what we do.   We value a customer service mindset and a collaborative approach, ensuring everyone's voice is heard. You'll need to demonstrate your ability to manage communications on a large scale, crafting multi-disciplinary programs.   As a trusted advisor to our stakeholders � including senior leaders � your expertise and influence will play a key role in delivering effective messaging. We want someone who can tackle complex issues with sensitivity and persuasiveness. Staying current with innovative best practices in communication is essential, as is tailoring messages to different audiences' needs.  Ability to coach and manage a team, as well as a track record of thriving in busy environments, is also key to this role.  Content production skills � such as graphic design and video creation � along with proficiency in Teams Live and measurement tools such as PowerBI are desirable, but we�re committed to personal development and have a broad range of training available to grow your skillset.
